Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Normothermic and Hypothermic Cardiopulmonary Bypass in Pediatric Tetralogy of Fallot Repair

Trial_Design.evidence: 100 patients aged 13 years or younger were randomised into two groups

Participants.evidence: Conducted at the University Children’s Hospital, Damascus, 100 patients aged 13 years or younger

Objective.evidence: This randomised controlled trial aimed to evaluate the early postoperative outcomes of normothermic cardiopulmonary bypass (NCPB) compared to hypothermic cardiopulmonary bypass (HCPB)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was mortality, measured over the postoperative period

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment ensured by sealed envelopes

Number_Randomised.evidence: 100 patients aged 13 years or younger were randomised into two groups

Number_Analysed.evidence: Seven deaths occurred, with a mortality rate of 7% (5 in HCPB, 2 in NCPB; p=0.25)

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant differences were found in mortality, morbidity, or postoperative complications between groups

Harms.evidence: Adverse events included heart failure, septic shock, and pulmonary hemorrhage
